messages.message:
Shreya is OOO today but the urgency for these issues are high since it is directly delaying development.  Especially the new issue, my understanding is that deleting the older app versions also deleted our golden set which would result in significant rework for the client.

To address this ASAP, can we schedule a call for tomorrow morning with @shreya.rajput so we can align on the impact and next steps?
I just sent out an invite blocking sometime tmr 10 AM ET / 7AM PT / 10PM TST. Feel free to update if it's not working...

> Especially the new issue, my understanding is that deleting the older app versions also deleted our golden set which would result in significant rework for the client.
we should have mentioned the ground truth set earlier!

btw it should be impossible to delete an app version that is associated with a ground truth set? in this case we return an error message (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/8983cde/shared-utils/py-utils/aihub-utils/src/py/instabase/aihub_utils/aihub_apps_util.py#L1447-L1448) (see PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/67898))

are we sure the ground truth set is deleted?

@Serena The ground truth is not visible on the UI but we can access it through the link. Which means other than viewing output value, I am surely not able to access it for say dataset creation. And my main concern here is- Will the data that I see in the link stay for next few weeks? or will it eventually get deleted?

The run which client had annotated-

 *Run:* 5a588702-c178-4792-b6d8-58bf68fd0062
 *Run Link:* https://nationwide.aihub.instabase.com/review/5a588702-c178-4792-b6d8-58bf68fd0062?deploymentId=0196c59b-9821-7f63-b245-40d092a28d8b (https://nationwide.aihub.instabase.com/review/5a588702-c178-4792-b6d8-58bf68fd0062?deploymentId=0196c59b-9821-7f63-b245-40d092a28d8b)

*If you go the deployment “Human Review” the run is not visible*
@Serena I am able to see the deployments now. It is not crashing.

@shreya.rajput what are we actually trying to recover? an app run, a deployment run, or a ground truth set? they are separate items, even though app runs can be used to create a ground truth set

it's difficult to provide appropriate guidance if we are unable to use consistent terminology

> *If you go the deployment “Human Review” the run is not visible*
are you talking about the "Review" tab in a workspace?

if this was an app run and not a deployment run, the app run would never have been shown in the "Review" tab of the workspace

Hi @Serena I understand your concern. We are trying to recover this particular run *Run:* 5a588702-c178-4792-b6d8-58bf68fd0062 .

By human-review (https://nationwide.aihub.instabase.com/deployments/0196c59b-9821-7f63-b245-40d092a28d8b/runs) _deployment_ I mean - https://nationwide.aihub.instabase.com/hub/apps/54c60927-456e-4f40-9039-f87167405750/deployments

Under this _deployment,_ we had _client's annotation run_-
 *Run:* 5a588702-c178-4792-b6d8-58bf68fd0062
 *Run Link* - https://nationwide.aihub.instabase.com/review/5a588702-c178-4792-b6d8-58bf68fd0062?deploymentId=0196c59b-9821-7f63-b245-40d092a28d8b

When you open '*human-review*' deployment- _This run is not visible_. It is also missing from 'App runs'.

*Concerns here-*
The run is *not visible in the UI*, but we can still *access it via a direct link*. However, it cannot be used to create a dataset for *accuracy calculation* because it’s missing from the UI.
*Questions:*
1. Will the data accessible through the link remain available for the next few weeks?
2. Or will it eventually be deleted?

> Will the data accessible through the link remain available for the next few weeks?
i see that no data retention policy is configured for this deployment (see docs)

so i think the data should remain accessible

i don't think this will be possible, i'm trying to recreate this on aihub-uat where i have a deployment run i can open but the deployed solution/deployment that it came from no longer exists and then trying to create a ground truth set for a different deployed solution. the error i get is: `No deployed solution job found for job_id 9491d61a-88fd-410b-8dcb-c93ce75d8f64 and deployed solution id 5f49212d-4ae6-4ab5-a85b-3bbd3b589ec7`  it looks like for an app run to be used to create a ground truth set the deployed solution it came from needs to exist.

just to understand, from my testing, the delete app endpoint deletes all versions, so i'm confused as to how u guys were able to unblock yourselves in the first place without deleting the whole app?
